title: Adaptation to inhomogeneous smoothness for densities with irregularities
abstract:
We estimate on a compact interval densities with isolated irregularities,
such as discontinuities or discontinuities in some derivatives. From
independent and identically distributed observations we construct a kernel
estimator with non-constant bandwidth, in particular in the vicinity of
irregularities. It attains faster rates, for the risk $L_{p}, p\geq 1$, than
usual estimators with a fixed global bandwidth. Optimality of the rate found is
established by a lower bound result. We then propose an adaptive method
inspired by Lepski's method for automatically selecting the variable bandwidth,
without any knowledge of the regularity of the density nor of the points where
the regularity breaks down. The procedure is illustrated numerically on
examples.
